results.description:
This group aims to help people who struggle with taking action, decision making, managing stress, balancing work and family, and who are in the general pursuit of happiness. It's for people who are tired of talking about their problems, and would like to learn skill-building exercises to manage and support positive emotions. Only when our emotions support our resulting thoughts, can thoughts be transformed into action. Otherwise, it's an uphill battle, with us trying to force ourselves into thinking or being a certain way. Positive thinking might just not be enough!

You will learn about the power of observation vs. being a part of the negativity of your mind. This separation helps us acknowledge that there is a problem to solve, without being sucked into becoming part of the problem.

Examples of practical application in one's own life include managing reactions to stress, managing the impact of our emotions on our lives personally and professionally, tempering our responses to rejection and interpersonal conflict, and pursuing true happiness.

Mindfulness is also used to heal eating disorders, stop smoking, stop drinking, relieve depression and anxiety, and many other areas in life resistant to traditional methods.

There will be free as well as paid events in this group. It will say which with each meetup that is scheduled.
results.name: The Masterful You Self-Help Through Mindfulness Group

results.description:
This group is an invitation to come together to meditate. New to meditation, experienced or in between, everybody is welcome to the group. Chopra's meditation method is very simple and easy to understand.

I give the basic instructions and we practice silent meditation for about 20 minutes. We reinforce the practice with a centering thought from Chopra's teachings.  We also suggest daily mindful activities so that with practice they become habits of a healthy and focused mind.  Meditation is the basic tool for a more wholesome relaxed life and when it is paired with mindful action it becomes the key that unlocks your connection to your intrinsic nature that is whole, creative and happy.

I am Chopra Center certified meditation instructor and a meditation based life coach. Meditation is the basis to my practice, and I often lead seminars & workshops.
results.name: Deepak Chopra NY Meditation & Mindfulness Group

What will you get out of this group? What you put into it. We hope this group provides an opportunity to create and cultivate…

What is Match Game NYC? It's a free monthly bar night and party game that's more fun than [BLANK]!

In MATCH GAME NYC audience members (that's you) form teams to match a series of “fill in the blank” questions with our witty celebrity panelists. The most matches by the top two teams win cool stuff! 

Match Game NYC is a fun free-for-all (or FREE fun-for-all) perfect for groups, icebreakers, first dates, parleys, and of course Meetups! 

Why is Match Game not your average bar night out with friends? Because in MATCH GAME NYC everyone can play or dive right in, there’s zero downtime, and there are no wrong answers... only one perfect match! 

So upgrade your bar night and break free of the bingo/trivia blues! And be sure to join us every 1st Thursday at Sidewalk for all the [BLANKS] you can handle!

results.description:
Welcome! Big Data Ingesters,

This meetup has been formed to discuss customer use cases and design patterns for big data ingestion, transformation, and egression. Use cases for transformations include fast real-time analytics, data movement, disastor recovery in Hadoop, data integration, fast batch, and database load/off-load. Key focus will be on integrating Hadoop with various systems including Message Systems, File Systems, and Databases. Users should be able to connect to any source and any destination from within Hadoop. Ability to leverage any user code as part of the connections and transformations. We expect to develop a strong community that meets face to face in New York, and has a deep influence on big data ecosystem.

Examples of Messaging Systems include ActiveMQ, Flume, JMS, Kafka, Kinesis Streams, MapR Streams, Nifi, RabbitMQ, Solace, ZeroMQ, etc.

Examples of File Systems include HDFS, FTP, NFS, S3, SFTP, MapR-FS etc.

Examples of Databases/Stores include Accumulo, AeroSpike, Cassandra, CouchDb, MongoDB, HBase, Couchbase, Geode, HBase, Hive Tables, MapR-DB, Impala, JDBC, HP Vertica, MemCache, MemSql, MySql, Oracle, Redis, etc.

Examples of protocols include AMPQ, HTTP, MQTT, SMTP, Rest/Soap, Twitter, Websockets, etc.

Other connectors include ElasticSearch, Splunk, Solr etc.

Our events will include production customer who will present their use cases.

We want to develop a strong community that meets face to face and has a deep influence on big data ecosystem. If you are interested in stepping up and helping organize this meet-up, please email to ingest-meetup@datatorrent.com. 

Apache Apex Community Organizer
results.name: Big Data (native Hadoop) Ingest&Transform, New York Chapter

results.description: The CUNY Fatherhood Academy, is a comprehensive program designed to promote responsible parenting and economic stability for unemployed and underemployed young fathers through education, employment, and personal development. Increasing familial engagement, attaining a High School Equivalency (HSE) diploma or wants to attend college, and acquiring gainful employment are all essential goals for the participants enrolled in the CFA. The program’s central focus is to help young fathers prepare for and enroll into college with the understanding that earning a college degree is the most effective path toward providing long-term economic sustainability for themselves and their families. HSE TASC (GED) Track At CFA participants will receive, for FREE: • Preparation for the TASC, NY’s high school equivalency exam or CUNY Skills Assessment Test • Career and educational exploration. • Preparation for college enrollment and job placement. • Work experience through internships and/or part-time jobs. • Workshops on important parenthood topics including familial bonding, health, and financial literacy. • Metrocards, incentives, food coupons and more. COLLEGE Track • CUNY Entrance Exam Prep • Internship Placement • Employment Readiness & Career Exploration • Employment Placement • Men’s & Parenting Workshops • College Enrollment & Financial Aid assistance • Metrocards, incentives food coupons and more. To be eligible they must be: • Male between the ages of 18 and 24 years • Eligible to work in the United States (citizen, have a green card, or have a work visa) • Not enrolled in college or another training program. • Have a child or be expecting a baby.
results.name: CUNY Fatherhood Academy

topics.name: Singles Who Love to Travel Travel

results.description:
WELCOME TO RAINBOW TRAVELERS NETWORK!

This group is for ALL members of the LGBT community (and their allies) who love to travel! Tired of being limited to men/women-only cruises or pride events as a way to explore the world with gay friends, family or significant others? Want to meet others from our community with the same wanderlust?...then the Rainbow Travelers Network is for you! 

Our intension is to bring together all those under the rainbow who want more than a cruisy cruise or an all-inclusive on an island (although that's definitely fun too)....and want to really experience culture, food, history, art, music, people, language and all the wonders that each destination truly offers. We have worked tirelessly to accrue reputable suppliers, many who are affiliated with the IGLTA (International Gay and Lesbian Travel association) and are proud to provide services to the LGBT community. 

Through small intimate groups aimed at 12-15 people - we plan to provide authentic, intimate experiences so you can truly enjoy the trip and get to know your fellow travelers. As interest grows for certain itineraries, there is a potential for groups to become larger. Because we truly want to be all-encompassing, there will be a mix of itineraries with destinations both domestic and international, various accommodation levels and price point, active and leisure itineraries, etc. Also, some trips will be joining larger groups and some will be private tours just for us.  Although our main objective is to create itineraries for a mixed group of member, there will be occasional trips that will have a specific demographic focus (i.e. men or women only).

Stay tuned for upcoming meetups where we can discuss current trips and ideas for the future. 

Look forward to hearing from you and hope you join us one one of our up coming trips!....LET'S SEE THE WORLD TOGETHER! 

Please contact us with any questions.

Best regards,

Aurelio
results.name: Rainbow Travelers Network

results.description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community.

I believe that the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, artificial intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What?

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How?

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive analysis of Hyperledger startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

• How others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

https://www.hyperledger.org

https://github.com/hyperledger

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.
results.name: Hyperledger (NYC Chapter)

results.description:
We all are fellow travelers on the road in search for home~ a place where you can be comfortable and just be yourself. A long journey full of adventures is awaiting for us to explore and a silent whispering awakens our dormant spirits, "Do not fear but believe". 

New York Village welcomes people coming from all over the world speaking different languages and sharing their cultures. Just like a rainbow that blends different colors into one beautiful mix of styles and sounds.

1. WHAT HOBBIES DO YOU ENJOY DOING OR WHAT IS YOUR AREA OF EXPERTISE THAT YOU'D LIKE TO SHARE WITH OTHERS?: All you have to do is ask us to organize an activity of your preference and we'll invite other members to join you!

Here are some of our suggestions~

- Language Sessions: Conversation sessions, 24x7 Group Chat rooms in Kakaotalk (Korean, Spanish, English and French), etc. 

- Cultural Experiences: Getting a Full-body Scrubbing Massage at Jjimjilbang(Korean style sauna), Recording your own favorite Songs at Noraebang, Food Tasting tours in Traditional Markets, etc.

- Fun Events: Going to International Restaurants for EXOTIC Cuisines, Group Visits to interesting Festivals and Touristic places, Girl's Chat Nights, Salsa Dance sessions, International Movie Nights, etc. 

- Outdoor activities: Walking Tours, Group Hiking, Bike Riding and Yoga at the Park, etc. 

- Sharing Your Knowledge and Skills: Introducing your Home Country to others, Leading Conversation sessions in your Favorite Language, Teaching others How to Cook and Bake, etc.

2. IF YOU HAVE RECENTLY ARRIVED TO NEW YORK, WOULD YOU LIKE US TO INTRODUCE YOU SOMEONE WHO CAN HELP YOU GET FAMILIAR WITH THE LOCAL CULTURE?: We'll help you find new friends who can share their experiences of having lived in New York. 

Hopefully, you'll find these activities helpful for integrating yourself better with the local culture and community. We do our best with the few resources we have but the idea is to take small steps forward into making New York a little bit more friendly for all our friends coming from the different corners of the world.

Welcome to New York~
results.name: New York Village

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in motorcycle or scooter riding. All skill levels and motorcycle/scooter makes and models are welcome (250 cc or higher). Our rides are mostly back roads to enjoy the scenic countryside. This group was started to meet other rider enthusiasts. We are looking forward to exploring the scenic back roads with everybody.

Rides will be posted on the Calendar and please RSVP based on the guidelines for that particular ride. 

For upcoming rides, I will watch the weather closely and will make a determination  the day before the ride. If it's obvious that the ride is going to be a total wash out I'll cancel or reschedule the ride on Meetup (all RSVP-Yes participants should receive an email notification). Be sure to check the site often.

If there is a slight chance of rain, please pack your rain gear. We'll go slow or pull over undercover if we get caught in a passing downpour.

If we get to the meetup place and it starts raining, I'll get a feel from the group what they want to do, ride or cancel.

We typically stop throughout the ride for a break and or breakfast/lunch.

These are social rides, so not work discussions allow. Please no soliciting.

I've attached a link about group riding that pretty much describe our riding group style. Please take a moment to read the General Group Riding to include, positioning, passing, group behavior and an alternate to route sheets and remember SAFETY is number one. http://www.motorcycle.com/rider-safety/grou...;

During the non-riding months, we can plan to meet, plan rides, and discuss riding.

NOTE:

All riders must sign a liability release form the day of the ride, it will be provided to you at the meet- up location.

We really look forward to meeting New Jersey Scenic Road Riders
results.name: North Jersey Scenic Road Riders

Come, express yourself, heal yourself and simply have fun joining this C.A.T. session. In this modern world we are burdened with deadlines, our self image, our social media image, our financial and relationship issues, this technique will help you appreciate and understand the importance of the NOW. You will spend an hour with me tapping into your creative flow creating a one of a kind piece of artwork that you will take home. 

Why: 

- fun - helps to develop interpersonal skills - helps to reduce stress - increase self-awareness - self-healing - empowerment - develops creative thinking and freedom of expression

results.description: Transcend Group Coaching: Understand yourself better and create deep connection with others Do you find yourself defining who you are by your career, family, where you live, your race, ethnicity, gender, and/or sexual orientation? How you define yourself often limits you to playing a role, rather than developing an expanding sense of purpose. The truth is, these are simply our roles in society, not who we truly are. What happens when we attach ourselves to these roles too much? Attachment to our roles leads to overwhelming expectations, self-judgment, negative thoughts and beliefs. We can have expectations of attaining the perfect version of whatever role we are in, have fears of vulnerability, and judge ourselves harshly. We can become plagued with self-doubt: Am I smart enough? Am I good enough? Our thoughts and beliefs lead to our perceptions about the world and ourselves. It is as if we have blinders on which we seem to have no choice and a limited view on everything. Because of this, we are disconnected from others and ourselves. Success and happiness seem unreachable. How can we live a life where we honor who we really are, make conscious choices unaffected by misconceptions, and create the success and happiness we want? Mission: Transcend Group Coaching is a network of individuals that are on the journey to understand themselves better and create deep connection to others by supporting each other in living passionate and authentic lives. Through releasing these attachments to our roles, we can live more authentically, honoring who we truly are, and enjoying every moment. Together this group will support each other in reducing unrealistic societal, familial, and personal expectations. We will break through barriers we have created with in ourselves for years and live more in the present moment. We will reduce fear and judgment while increasing happiness, success, and connection. Imagine this new you at a crowded party, talking to someone you are attracted to; at a work event; or an awkward family gathering, having the confidence to connect with people in new ways, having meaningful conversation, and engaging with others like never before. In this group you will release self-doubt, fear, loneliness, and insecurities, and replace it with confidence, courage, and a support network to live a connected, conscious, and aware life. In my coaching practice, I have been recognized for my ability to ask thought-provoking questions to help individuals and groups dig deeper into exploring who they are and what is important to them. With monthly conference phone calls, an online community forum, weekly discussion questions, and individually defined actions steps, I will help create an environment of support, motivation, and inspiration. We will break down physical, mental, and spiritual barriers that have gotten in the way of connecting with others and ourselves. The fact is that everyone has challenges, limiting beliefs, assumptions and judgments about themselves and the world. Together we will embrace our challenges, understand our desires, and live our purpose… Get ready to Transcend! The Benefits of Conference Calls for Group Coaching As we connect with people around us we are drawn to similarities. We are attracted to people that look like us, have similar clothing or other outward traits. These superficial characteristics can either create connection with people or stop us from getting to know them. It is common to put more weight on these superficial characteristics of people but the reality is that it can keep us from getting to know them in deeper ways. Through group phone conversation, we will transcend physical superficial barriers and focus instead on the energy, values, and beliefs of each person. It will help create a new way of being. With this new awareness, we will honor what makes us all unique, truly learning from each other and growing together.
results.name: New York Transcend Group Coaching

results.description:
***THIS IS NOT A PRO OR ANTI TRUMP GROUP. JUST A GROUP FORMED TO HAVE THOUGHTFUL CONVERSATION.***

No matter what your position, whether you're for him or against him, no one can deny that Donald Trump, and his hostile takeover of the Republican party, is not only the most covered topic in mainstream media over the past 6 months, but it is also historical and epic in how it may change the way we define ourselves (and the way the world defines us).

Over the past 6 months, I've had many conversations with people from all walks of life about the Trump phenomenon. Usually, they are usually hushed conversations (often with strangers like my Uber drivers, or with people at work, at my local coffee shop, etc.). This much became clear, people feel strongly (either way) and have a NEED to talk about their positions, their anger, their fear and what they HOPE will happen in the coming months.

This group is for people who like to have thoughtful, and thought-provoking, conversation. Each monthly meetup will be in formal setting where we will be divided into groups of 5-10 to discuss a series of specific topics covered in the media around Trump's rise and eminent nomination or brokered/open convention. We will change groups with each topic, to mix things up and get to know other people and points of view.

This is NOT a Trump event. This is not meant to support, or denounce Trump or any political party. It's a discussion group and all members MUST be respectful of other people and their right to have their own opinions.
results.name: Conversation Group: Let's Talk About Trump

Who is this for?

If you're transforming your professional life, but find yourself at times stuck, not sure of where/how to start, in need of outside opinions, or in need of accountability so that you're taking consistent action to accomplish your goals, then this group is for you. 


Benefits of joining this group?

1. You can participate in smaller peer advisory groups that meet regularly to solve your biggest challenges (e.g. interview prep, resume review, etc) and hold you accountable.

2. You can contact broader community for motivation, advice, and networking.

3. You can get access to special trainings, events, and other ancillary offerings (e.g. LInkedIn optimization, interview workshops, etc)


This group will focus on the most common and troublesome professional challenges. By working with like-minded individuals, you can leverage each other's knowledge, experience, research, and network in order to ACHIEVE MORE in LESS TIME.

results.description:
After two years of silence, face to face is revamped and ready to get guys together the old fashioned way...face to face.

Grindr, tindr, scruff, adam 4 adam, hornet...I'm sure I'm forgetting a few. It seems to be harder to meet someone in person without first  having a full background check ran, submitting 15 different head-shots, and really good wifi to combat the ever-present possibility of the network crashing or worse...your depleted and gay dating app obliterated iphone battery giving out.

The purpose of this group is to give gay men the opportunity to meet outside of the digital dating world. Convenient as it is, online dating doesn't work for everyone. What makes this group unique is that there are no categories; any and all guys are welcome to come. This is an all inclusive group that gets guys to get out of their comfort zone and meeting people they may otherwise missed. The desire to meet in person is alive, but ironically the more options we have the less likely we are to ever breakthrough the iphone screen. Whether you meet a lover or friend, you'll be happy you joined. Share a bit about yourself!
results.name: Face To Face - Back To The Basics

results.description:
This group is for professional single Muslims in New York City who want to meet like-minded people.

It’s a great start for Muslim Community who find it difficult to communicate with new people and it’s really frustrating sometimes to look for a life partner especially if you are an expat or have a very busy schedule. That’s why I am here to make you feel comfortable in meeting like-minded people around you who holds the same interest as you.

As someone well said;

“We don’t meet people by accident. They are meant to cross our path for a reason.”

The plan is to have regular events ranging from dinner, bowling, lunch, coffee, cruises, karting etc. - so please feel free suggest anything you want me to organise or want to volunteer to organise :)

InshAllah look forward to seeing you at one of our events soon.

Please note:

• This isn't a casual dating / hook-up group.

• Please do not apply if you are married.

• There is an annual membership fee of 25 Dollar.

• Sending private messages / emails to other members you haven't met - especially the ladies is not allowed.

• Anyone reported for doing so will be banned.

• Any no shows / change of RSVPs on the day of the event will be banned.

• Annual membership fee runs from January - December and is non-refundable / negotiable.

• The membership fee is payable in cash at your 1st event.

• If you don't attend an event within 3 months, you will be removed from the group.

Thanks for your kind consideration and hope to see you all soon :)

Amna :)
